Nim

Class SmartComputer

  • java.lang.Object
    • Nim.SmartComputer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Player

    public class SmartComputer
extends java.lang.Object
implements Player
    An computer that is a selectable player in the game of Nim (a very intelligent player!)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SmartComputer()
      Constructs a Smart Computer A.I.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getName()
      Gets the name of the Smart Computer
      int move(int pileCount)
      Smart Computer makes a move by removing an amount from anywhere between 1 to half the amount of marbles present in the pile such that the amount of marbles in the pile after it's turn is a power of 2
      boolean wantsFirstPlay()
      Smart Computer will play first if it is passed as the first player to the Nim Constructor

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SmartComputer

        public SmartComputer()
        Constructs a Smart Computer A.I.

    • Method Detail

      • move

        public int move(int pileCount)
        Smart Computer makes a move by removing an amount from anywhere between 1 to half the amount of marbles present in the pile such that the amount of marbles in the pile after it's turn is a power of 2
        Specified by:
        move in interface Player
        Parameters:
        pileCount - the amount of marbles in the pile
        Returns:
        the amount of marbles to be removed from the pile

      • wantsFirstPlay

        public boolean wantsFirstPlay()
        Smart Computer will play first if it is passed as the first player to the Nim Constructor
        Specified by:
        wantsFirstPlay in interface Player
        Returns:
        a value of true to specify that the A.I. wants to play first; this is only applicable when A.I. play against each other -- yes, they can play against each other in this version of the game :)

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Gets the name of the Smart Computer
        Specified by:
        getName in interface Player
        Returns:
        name of the Smart A.I.
